property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
Accessor that outputs the current status of all top-level accessors.

Upon receiving an input, this accessor outputs an array of objects, one for each top-level accessor. Each object has the following fields:

  • accessorName: The name of the accessor.
  • accessorClass: The class of the accessor, e.g. net/REST.

  • initialized: True if the accessor has been initialized and not wrapped up.

    This accessor can only be used in a host that allows trusted accessors. Trusted accessors must have class names beginning with 'trusted/' and are allowed to invoke the function getTopLevelAccessors() to obtain access to peer accessors.

    FIXME: This is really just a bare minimum starting point. The query input should be able to specify various operations, such as watching accessors for their event emissions, timing the execution of accessors, etc.
